## Functions

### getNewCapacity() {#aaacda3d173fc2125198e9fc756841767}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;class Size&#95;T&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>static size&#95;t getNewCapacity (size&#95;t MinSize, size&#95;t TSize, size&#95;t OldCapacity)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>

</MemberDefinition>

### replaceAllocation() {#af529edaff902b7a5f2370f71ed88db1e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static void &#42; replaceAllocation (void &#42; NewElts, size&#95;t TSize, size&#95;t NewCapacity, size&#95;t VSize=0)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
If vector was first created with capacity 0, getFirstEl() points to the memory right after, an area unallocated.

If a subsequent allocation, that grows the vector, happens to return the same pointer as getFirstEl(), get a new allocation, otherwise isSmall() will falsely return that no allocation was done (true) and the memory will not be freed in the destructor. If a VSize is given (vector size), also copy that many elements to the new allocation - used if realloca fails to increase space, and happens to allocate precisely at BeginX. This is unlikely to be called often, but resolves a memory leak when the situation does occur.

Definition at line <a href="#l00121">121</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/smallvector-cpp">SmallVector.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### report&#95;at&#95;maximum&#95;capacity() {#aaba83d1439bd004981452b39ad73c3c0}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static void report&#95;at&#95;maximum&#95;capacity (size&#95;t MaxSize)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Report that this vector is already at maximum capacity.

Throws std::length&#95;error or calls report&#95;fatal&#95;error.

Definition at line <a href="#l00077">77</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/smallvector-cpp">SmallVector.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### report&#95;size&#95;overflow() {#a16781b016f45fba1aa015dc59ba7e653}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static void report&#95;size&#95;overflow (size&#95;t MinSize, size&#95;t MaxSize)</>}

<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Note: Moving this function into the header may cause performance regression.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Size&#95;T&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90" lineLink="#aaacda3d173fc2125198e9fc756841767"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="#aaacda3d173fc2125198e9fc756841767">getNewCapacity</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MinSize, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> TSize, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> OldCapacity) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">constexpr</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MaxSize = std::numeric&#95;limits&lt;Size&#95;T&gt;::max();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Ensure we can fit the new capacity.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This is only going to be applicable when the capacity is 32 bit.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (MinSize &gt; MaxSize)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="#a16781b016f45fba1aa015dc59ba7e653">report&#95;size&#95;overflow</a>(MinSize, MaxSize);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Ensure we can meet the guarantee of space for at least one more element.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The above check alone will not catch the case where grow is called with a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// default MinSize of 0, but the current capacity cannot be increased.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This is only going to be applicable when the capacity is 32 bit.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (OldCapacity == MaxSize)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="#aaba83d1439bd004981452b39ad73c3c0">report&#95;at&#95;maximum&#95;capacity</a>(MaxSize);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// In theory 2&#42;capacity can overflow if the capacity is 64 bit, but the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// original capacity would never be large enough for this to be a problem.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> NewCapacity = 2 &#42; OldCapacity + 1; </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Always grow.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> std::clamp(NewCapacity, MinSize, MaxSize);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If vector was first created with capacity 0, getFirstEl() points to the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// memory right after, an area unallocated. If a subsequent allocation,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// that grows the vector, happens to return the same pointer as getFirstEl(),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// get a new allocation, otherwise isSmall() will falsely return that no</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// allocation was done (true) and the memory will not be freed in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// destructor. If a VSize is given (vector size), also copy that many</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// elements to the new allocation - used if realloca fails to increase</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// space, and happens to allocate precisely at BeginX.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This is unlikely to be called often, but resolves a memory leak when the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// situation does occur.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121" lineLink="#af529edaff902b7a5f2370f71ed88db1e"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;<a href="#af529edaff902b7a5f2370f71ed88db1e">replaceAllocation</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;NewElts, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> TSize, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> NewCapacity,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><span class="doxyHighlight">                               </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> VSize = 0) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;NewEltsReplace = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a8bb931812d78f470d4ca775ac8b88e61">llvm::safe&#95;malloc</a>(NewCapacity &#42; TSize);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (VSize)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><span class="doxyHighlight">    memcpy(NewEltsReplace, NewElts, VSize &#42; TSize);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><span class="doxyHighlight">  free(NewElts);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> NewEltsReplace;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Note: Moving this function into the header may cause performance regression.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Size&#95;T&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorbase/#a2c068750374c249c3498144297eda93c"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorbase/#a2c068750374c249c3498144297eda93c">SmallVectorBase&lt;Size&#95;T&gt;::mallocForGrow</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;FirstEl, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MinSize,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                             </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> TSize,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                             </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &amp;NewCapacity) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><span class="doxyHighlight">  NewCapacity = <a href="#aaacda3d173fc2125198e9fc756841767">getNewCapacity&lt;Size&#95;T&gt;</a>(MinSize, TSize, this-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorbase/#ad5cd3f01e0e643f56beff88ff86dd5da">capacity</a>());</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Even if capacity is not 0 now, if the vector was originally created with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// capacity 0, it&#39;s possible for the malloc to return FirstEl.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;NewElts = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a8bb931812d78f470d4ca775ac8b88e61">llvm::safe&#95;malloc</a>(NewCapacity &#42; TSize);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (NewElts == FirstEl)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><span class="doxyHighlight">    NewElts = <a href="#af529edaff902b7a5f2370f71ed88db1e">replaceAllocation</a>(NewElts, TSize, NewCapacity);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> NewElts;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Note: Moving this function into the header may cause performance regression.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Size&#95;T&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorbase/#a0fef5db8f0b473292cb9770075050da5"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorbase/#a0fef5db8f0b473292cb9770075050da5">SmallVectorBase&lt;Size&#95;T&gt;::grow&#95;pod</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;FirstEl, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MinSize,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                       </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> TSize) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> NewCapacity = <a href="#aaacda3d173fc2125198e9fc756841767">getNewCapacity&lt;Size&#95;T&gt;</a>(MinSize, TSize, this-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorbase/#ad5cd3f01e0e643f56beff88ff86dd5da">capacity</a>());</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;NewElts;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorbase/#aeae003355ebd5135c415924b38964abd">BeginX</a> == FirstEl) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><span class="doxyHighlight">    NewElts = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a8bb931812d78f470d4ca775ac8b88e61">llvm::safe&#95;malloc</a>(NewCapacity &#42; TSize);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (NewElts == FirstEl)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><span class="doxyHighlight">      NewElts = <a href="#af529edaff902b7a5f2370f71ed88db1e">replaceAllocation</a>(NewElts, TSize, NewCapacity);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Copy the elements over.  No need to run dtors on PODs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><span class="doxyHighlight">    memcpy(NewElts, this-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorbase/#aeae003355ebd5135c415924b38964abd">BeginX</a>, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/nvvmreflect-cpp/#ac934769d93af95250952646a3829df4c">size</a>() &#42; TSize);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If this wasn&#39;t grown from the inline copy, grow the allocated space.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><span class="doxyHighlight">    NewElts = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9edff61a0e003a8bb37f5a12a8755cf2">llvm::safe&#95;realloc</a>(this-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorbase/#aeae003355ebd5135c415924b38964abd">BeginX</a>, NewCapacity &#42; TSize);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (NewElts == FirstEl)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><span class="doxyHighlight">      NewElts = <a href="#af529edaff902b7a5f2370f71ed88db1e">replaceAllocation</a>(NewElts, TSize, NewCapacity, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/nvvmreflect-cpp/#ac934769d93af95250952646a3829df4c">size</a>());</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><span class="doxyHighlight">  this-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorbase/#a435b1238f81c19cd3bd557fe9af58ed9">set&#95;allocation&#95;range</a>(NewElts, NewCapacity);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorbase">llvm::SmallVectorBase&lt;uint32&#95;t&gt;</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Disable the uint64&#95;t instantiation for 32-bit builds.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Both uint32&#95;t and uint64&#95;t instantiations are needed for 64-bit builds.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This instantiation will never be used in 32-bit builds, and will cause</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// warnings when sizeof(Size&#95;T) &gt; sizeof(size&#95;t).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#if SIZE&#95;MAX &gt; UINT32&#95;MAX</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorbase">llvm::SmallVectorBase&lt;uint64&#95;t&gt;</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Assertions to ensure this #if stays in sync with SmallVectorSizeType.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static&#95;assert</span><span class="doxyHighlight">(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">sizeof</span><span class="doxyHighlight">(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a8c03fc5361775d8b9c9412745110274b">SmallVectorSizeType&lt;char&gt;</a>) == </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">sizeof</span><span class="doxyHighlight">(uint64&#95;t),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><span class="doxyHighlight">              </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Expected SmallVectorBase&lt;uint64&#95;t&gt; variant to be in use.&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#else</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static&#95;assert</span><span class="doxyHighlight">(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">sizeof</span><span class="doxyHighlight">(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a8c03fc5361775d8b9c9412745110274b">SmallVectorSizeType&lt;char&gt;</a>) == </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">sizeof</span><span class="doxyHighlight">(uint32&#95;t),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"><span class="doxyHighlight">              </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Expected SmallVectorBase&lt;uint32&#95;t&gt; variant to be in use.&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#endif</span></CodeLine>
